page.title: 11IN THE NEWS:B&R EXPRESS
page.content:
Here are some items of Builth Wells news from this week's "Brecon & Radnor Express", October 31st 1985.
A {Sponsored Balloon Race}began from the Groe last Saturday in aid of Children In Need. More than Â£200 was raised for the charity by selling balloons for 50p each. A photograph shows the Mayor of Builth,Mr Dennis Price,inflating the first balloon to be released.The person whose balloon travels furthest by 15th December will receive a giant teddy bear from the sponsors, N.P.Building Society. Mr Glyn Rees,a member of the {Bowling {Club}for 38 years,has been made a Life Member. {Mrs Olive}Williams,a teacher at the Builth Wells Primary School for 18 years will be retiring at the end of the term.
